medical_history.chief_complaint: Metastatic vulvar melanoma with diffuse cutaneous melanosis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: A pigmented lesion of the right labia majora was first noted in January 1996. The lesion became progressively raised, tender, and bled intermittently. Diagnosis was confirmed in August 1996 with a biopsy. After treatment, in January 1999, a chest CT scan indicated a 6-mm lung nodule, leading to the diagnosis of metastatic melanoma. The patient experienced rapid disease progression with the development of large masses and generalized melanosis. In pregnancy, complications included intussusception related to a metastatic mass and elevated lactate dehydrogenase levels, indicating worsening disease.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of metastatic melanoma, including stage III mucosal lentiginous vulvar melanoma and prior therapeutic interventions such as subcutaneous interferon alfa injections and BCG vaccine treatment.
